intro: Tetrapogon mossambicensis, commonly known as the African haircap moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright shoots and small, elongated leaves that are often slightly curved. The plant forms dense cushions or mats, typically growing in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its spore-producing structures, called sporophytes, are distinctive and contribute to its identification. Tetrapogon mossambicensis plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native range.
